oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Map of Mufreesboro, detail from Map of Rutherford County, Tenn. : from actual surveys
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Towns, Neighborhoods
African American neighborhoods
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This detail of Murfeesboro from the 1878 Beers map of Rutherford County shows the early development of the sixth ward African American neighborhood near the public square. A Baptist church (Col. Bapt. Ch.) was located on the corner of Sevier and Spring, and another church (Col. Ch.) was on State Street.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: This item is in the public domain and may be used freely.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Map of Rutherford County, Tenn. : from actual surveys. D.G. Beers & Co., 1878.
